API docs by Redocly

SimpleLogin (unofficial) (4.22.0)

Download OpenAPI specification:Download

Kenneth Wußmann: contact@ketrwu.de URL: https://github.com/KennethWussmann/simplelogin-client License: MIT

The unofficial SimpleLogin API docs as OpenAPI 3.0.0 spec. This is based on the official markdown based docs, but written in OpenAPI to allow for easier integration with other tools and generation of client SDKs. Please do not contact the SimpleLogin team for support or issues with this API documentation.

account

Activate account

Activate a new account with the activation code that was sent to the user's email.

Request Body schema: application/json
email
required
string (Email)

Email address

code
required
string

Activation code sent to email

Responses

SimpleLogin API

https://app.simplelogin.io/api/auth/activate

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/json
{
  • "email": "firstname.lastname@example.com",
  • "code": "string"
}

Response samples

  • 400
  • 410
Content type
application/json
{
  • "error": "string"
}

Forgot password

Request a link to reset the password for a registered account.

Request Body schema: application/json
email
required
string (Email)

Email address

Responses

SimpleLogin API

https://app.simplelogin.io/api/auth/forgot_password

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/json
{
  • "email": "firstname.lastname@example.com"
}

Login

Login using email and password to get an access token.

Request Body schema: application/json
email
required
string (Email)

Email address

password
required
string
device
required
string

Responses

SimpleLogin API

https://app.simplelogin.io/api/auth/login

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/json
{
  • "email": "firstname.lastname@example.com",
  • "password": "string",
  • "device": "string"
}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "name": "string",
  • "email": "firstname.lastname@example.com",
  • "mfa_enabled": true,
  • "mfa_key": "string",
  • "api_key": "string"
}

MFA authentication

Authenticate using MFA

Request Body schema: application/json

The api_key is used in all subsequent requests. It's empty if MFA is enabled. If user hasn't enabled MFA, mfa_key is empty.

mfa_token
required
string

OTP token that user enters

mfa_key
required
string

MFA key obtained in previous auth request

device
required
string

The device name, used to create an ApiKey associated with this device

Responses

SimpleLogin API

https://app.simplelogin.io/api/auth/mfa

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/json
{
  • "mfa_token": "string",
  • "mfa_key": "string",
  • "device": "string"
}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "name": "string",
  • "api_key": "string",
  • "email": "firstname.lastname@example.com"
}

Reactivate account

Request a new activation code for an account that was already registered, but not activated yet.

Request Body schema: application/json
email
required
string (Email)

Email address

Responses

SimpleLogin API

https://app.simplelogin.io/api/auth/reactivate

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/json
{
  • "email": "firstname.lastname@example.com"
}

Register account

Register a new account

Request Body schema: application/json
email
required
string <email>
password
required
string

Responses

SimpleLogin API

https://app.simplelogin.io/api/auth/register

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/json
{
  • "email": "user@example.com",
  • "password": "string"
}

Logout

Log out user

Authorizations:
apiKeyAuth

Responses

SimpleLogin API

https://app.simplelogin.io/api/logout

Response samples

  • 200
  • 401
  • 403
Content type
application/json
{
  • "name": "string",
  • "email": "firstname.lastname@example.com",
  • "is_premium": true,
  • "in_trial": true,
  • "profile_picture": "string",
  • "max_alias_free_plan": 0
}

Get stats

Returns stats about the number of aliases, number of emails forwarded/replied/blocked

Authorizations:
apiKeyAuth

Responses

SimpleLogin API

https://app.simplelogin.io/api/stats

Response samples

  • 200
  • 401
  • 403
Content type
application/json
{
  • "nb_alias": 0,
  • "nb_block": 0,
  • "nb_forward": 0,
  • "nb_reply": 0
}

  • "email": "firstname.lastname@example.com",
  • "is_premium": true,
  • "in_trial": true,
  • "profile_picture": "string",
  • "max_alias_free_plan": 0
}

Update user info

Update user info

Authorizations:
apiKeyAuth
Request Body schema: application/json
profile_picture
string <base64>

Image of the new profile picture encoded in base64. Set to null to remove current profile picture.

name
string

New name of the user

Responses

SimpleLogin API

https://app.simplelogin.io/api/user_info

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/json
{
  • "profile_picture": "string",
  • "name": "string"
}

Response samples

  • 200
  • 401
  • 403
Content type
application/json
{
  • "name": "string",
  • "email": "firstname.lastname@example.com",
  • "is_premium": true,
  • "in_trial": true,
  • "profile_picture": "string",
  • "max_alias_free_plan": 0
}

alias

Create random alias

Create a new random alias

Authorizations:
apiKeyAuth
query Parameters
hostname
string
Example: hostname=www.example.com

This information is important to know where an alias is used in order to suggest user the same alias if they want to create on alias on the same website in the future.

mode
string
Enum: "uuid" "word"

Either uuid or word. By default, use the user setting when creating new random alias.

Request Body schema: application/json
note
string

Note of this alias

Responses

SimpleLogin API

https://app.simplelogin.io/api/alias/random/new

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/json
{
  • "note": "string"
}

Response samples

  • 201
  • 401
  • 403
Content type
application/json
{
  • "creation_date": "2021-03-10 21:36:08+00:00",
  • "creation_timestamp": 0,
  • "email": "firstname.lastname@example.com",
  • "name": "string",
  • "enabled": true,
  • "id": 0,
  • "mailbox": {
    • "email": "firstname.lastname@example.com",
    • "id": 1
    },
  • "mailboxes": [
    • {
      • "email": "firstname.lastname@example.com",
      • "id": 1
      }
    ],
  • "latest_activity": {
    • "action": "string",
    • "contact": {
      • "email": "firstname.lastname@example.com",
      • "name": "string",
      • "reverse_alias": "string"
      },
    • "timestamp": 0
    },
  • "nb_block": 0,
  • "nb_forward": 0,
  • "nb_reply": 0,
  • "note": "string",
  • "pinned": true,
  • "disable_pgp": true,
  • "support_pgp": true
}

Get activities

Get activities for specific alias by id.

Authorizations:
apiKeyAuth
path Parameters
alias_id
required
number
Example: 142

ID of an alias

query Parameters
page_id
required
number >= 0
Default: 0
Example: page_id=0

The endpoint returns maximum 20 aliases for each page.

Responses

SimpleLogin API

https://app.simplelogin.io/api/aliases/{alias_id}/activities

Response samples

  • 200
  • 401
  • 403
  • 404
Content type
application/json
{
  • "activities": [
    • {
      • "action": "reply",
      • "from": "yes_meo_chat@sl.local",
      • "timestamp": 1580903760,
      • "to": "marketing@example.com",
      • "reverse_alias": "\"marketing at example.com\" <reply@a.b>",
      • "reverse_alias_address": "reply@a.b"
      }
    ]
}

Get contacts

Get contacts for specific alias by id.

Authorizations:
apiKeyAuth
path Parameters
alias_id
required
number
Example: 142

ID of an alias

query Parameters
page_id
required
number >= 0
Default: 0
Example: page_id=0

The endpoint returns maximum 20 aliases for each page.

Responses

SimpleLogin API

https://app.simplelogin.io/api/aliases/{alias_id}/contacts

Response samples

  • 200
  • 401
  • 403
  • 404
Content type
application/json
{
  • "contacts": [
    • {
      • "id": 1,
      • "contact": "marketing@example.com",
      • "creation_date": "2021-03-10 21:36:08+00:00",
      • "creation_timestamp": 1580903760,
      • "last_email_sent_date": "2021-03-10 21:36:08+00:00",
      • "last_email_sent_timestamp": null,
      • "reverse_alias": "marketing at example.com <reply+bzvpazcdedcgcpztehxzgjgzmxskqa@sl.co>",
      • "block_forward": false,
      • "existed": false
      }
    ]
}

Create contact

Authorizations:
apiKeyAuth
path Parameters
alias_id
required
number
Example: 142

ID of an alias

Request Body schema: application/json

Updated settings for the given alias.

contact
required
string (Email)

Email address

Responses

{
  • "contact": "firstname.lastname@example.com"
}

  • 201
  • 401
  • 403
  • 404
Content type
application/json
{
  • "id": 1,
  • "contact": "marketing@example.com",
  • "creation_date": "2021-03-10 21:36:08+00:00",
  • "creation_timestamp": 1580903760,
  • "last_email_sent_date": "2021-03-10 21:36:08+00:00",
  • "last_email_sent_timestamp": null,
  • "reverse_alias": "marketing at example.com <reply+bzvpazcdedcgcpztehxzgjgzmxskqa@sl.co>",
  • "block_forward": false,
  • "existed": false
}

Update alias

Update specific alias by id.

Authorizations:
apiKeyAuth
path Parameters
alias_id
required
number
Example: 142

ID of an alias

Request Body schema: application/json

Updated settings for the given alias.

note
string
mailbox_id
integer
name
string
mailbox_ids
Array of integers
disable_pgp
boolean
pinned
boolean

Responses

SimpleLogin API

https://app.simplelogin.io/api/aliases/{alias_id}

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/json
{
  • "note": "string",
  • "mailbox_id": 0,
  • "name": "string",
  • "mailbox_ids": [
    • 0
    ],
  • "disable_pgp": true,
  • "pinned": true
}

Response samples

  • 200
  • 401
  • 403
  • 404
Content type
application/json
{
  • "ok": true
}

Toggle alias

Enable or disable specific alias by id.

Authorizations:
apiKeyAuth
path Parameters
alias_id
required
number
Example: 142

ID of an alias

Responses

SimpleLogin API

https://app.simplelogin.io/api/aliases/{alias_id}/toggle

Response samples

  • 200
  • 401
  • 403
Content type
application/json
{
  • "enabled": false
}

Get aliases

Get user aliases. Please note pinned, disabled, enabled are exclusive, i.e. only one can be present. They can only be set to true.

Authorizations:
apiKeyAuth
query Parameters
page_id
required
number >= 0
Default: 0
Example: page_id=0

The endpoint returns maximum 20 aliases for each page.

pinned
boolean

If set, only pinned aliases are returned.

disabled
boolean

If set, only disabled aliases are returned.

enabled
boolean

If set, only enabled aliases are returned.

Responses

SimpleLogin API

https://app.simplelogin.io/api/v2/aliases

Response samples

  • 200
  • 401
  • 403
Content type
application/json
{
  • "aliases": [
    • {
      • "creation_date": "2021-03-10 21:36:08+00:00",
      • "creation_timestamp": 0,
      • "email": "firstname.lastname@example.com",
      • "name": "string",
      • "enabled": true,
      • "id": 0,
      • "mailbox": {
        • "email": "firstname.lastname@example.com",
        • "id": 1
        },
      • "mailboxes": [
        • {
          • "email": "firstname.lastname@example.com",
          • "id": 1
          }
        ],
      • "latest_activity": {
        • "action": "string",
        • "contact": {
          • "email": "firstname.lastname@example.com",
          • "name": "string",
          • "reverse_alias": "string"
          },
        • "timestamp": 0
        },
      • "nb_block": 0,
      • "nb_forward": 0,
      • "nb_reply": 0,
      • "note": "string",
      • "pinned": true,
      • "disable_pgp": true,
      • "support_pgp": true
      }
    ]
}

Create custom alias

Create a new custom alias

Authorizations:
apiKeyAuth
query Parameters
hostname
string
Example: hostname=www.example.com

This information is important to know where an alias is used in order to suggest user the same alias if they want to create on alias on the same website in the future.

Request Body schema: application/json
alias_prefix
required
string

The first part of the alias that user can choose.

signed_suffix
required
string

One of the suffixes returned in the options endpoint.

mailbox_ids
required
Array of numbers
note
string

Note of this alias

name
string

Name of this alias

Responses

SimpleLogin API

https://app.simplelogin.io/api/v3/alias/custom/new

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/json
{
  • "alias_prefix": "string",
  • "signed_suffix": "string",
  • "mailbox_ids": [
    • 0
    ],
  • "note": "string",
  • "name": "string"
}

Response samples

  • 201
  • 401
  • 403
Content type
application/json
{
  • "creation_date": "2021-03-10 21:36:08+00:00",
  • "creation_timestamp": 0,
  • "email": "firstname.lastname@example.com",
  • "name": "string",
  • "enabled": true,
  • "id": 0,
  • "mailbox": {
    • "email": "firstname.lastname@example.com",
    • "id": 1
    },
  • "mailboxes": [
    • {
      • "email": "firstname.lastname@example.com",
      • "id": 1
      }
    ],
  • "latest_activity": {
    • "action": "string",
    • "contact": {
      • "email": "firstname.lastname@example.com",
      • "name": "string",
      • "reverse_alias": "string"
      },
    • "timestamp": 0
    },
  • "nb_block": 0,
  • "nb_forward": 0,
  • "nb_reply": 0,
  • "note": "string",
  • "pinned": true,
  • "disable_pgp": true,
  • "support_pgp": true
}

Get alias options

User alias info and suggestion. Used by the first extension screen when user opens the extension.

Authorizations:
apiKeyAuth
query Parameters
hostname
string
Example: hostname=www.example.com

This information is important to know where an alias is used in order to suggest user the same alias if they want to create on alias on the same website in the future.

Responses

SimpleLogin API

https://app.simplelogin.io/api/v5/alias/options

Response samples

  • 200
  • 401
  • 403
Content type
application/json
{
  • "can_create": true,
  • "prefix_suggestion": "string",
  • "suffixes": [
    • {
      • "suffix": ".cat@d1.test",
      • "signed_suffix": ".cat@d1.test.X6_7OQ.0e9NbZHE_bQvuAapT6NdBml9m6",
      • "is_custom": true,
      • "is_premium": true
      }
    ],
  • "recommendation": {
    • "alias": "string",
    • "hostname": "string"
    }
}

  • "verified": true
}

Update mailbox

Update specific mailbox by id.

Authorizations:
apiKeyAuth
path Parameters
mailbox_id
required
number
Example: 142

ID of a mailbox

Request Body schema: application/json

Updated settings of mailbox

default
boolean

If true, set the mailbox as the default mailbox.

email
string (Email)

Email address

cancel_email_change
boolean

If true, cancel the email change of the mailbox.

Responses

SimpleLogin API

https://app.simplelogin.io/api/mailboxes/{mailbox_id}

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/json
{
  • "default": true,
  • "email": "firstname.lastname@example.com",
  • "cancel_email_change": true
}

Response samples

  • 400
  • 401
  • 403
Content type
application/json
{
  • "error": "string"
}

custom-domain

Get custom domains

Authorizations:
apiKeyAuth
path Parameters
alias_id
required
number
Example: 142

ID of an alias

Responses

https://app.simplelogin.io/api/custom_domains

Response samples

  • 200
  • 401
  • 403
  • 404
Content type
application/json
{
  • "catch_all": false,
  • "creation_date": "2021-03-10 21:36:08+00:00",
  • "creation_timestamp": 1580903760,
  • "domain_name": "test1.org",
  • "id": 1,
  • "is_verified": true,
  • "mailboxes": [
    • {
      • "email": "firstname.lastname@example.com",
      • "id": 1
      }
    ],
  • "name": "string",
  • "nb_alias": 0,
  • "random_prefix_generation": false
}
